comments.commentBody: I caught on right at the beginning with SAAA - all the downs had to be right, then ELIA developed at the end and the word ESSAYS (S, As) popped out at me and I was off and running. I totally agree with Mac's assessment.

Jeb insists that 9/11 occurred under Clinton and the collateralized debt/mortgage meltdown happened under Obama.  That's the GOP hot tub time machine strategy for winning, didn't you read the Rove directive?
"That was no pile of rubble, that was my family's legacy!"

Agreed, but at least we know who and what Trump is and he's just being La Donald. I'd be worried if he tried to (pu on an) act like something other than the sexist, know it all, obnoxious, loud mouth, egomaniac bully that we all know him to be.

I suspect Trump and Carson have both peaked. Neither one did himself any favors tonight, and Carson demonstrated there is no there, there. Trump came across as the rude bully that he is, and really had nothing to show for himself. Fiorina, Kasich, Rubio and Paul did well.

But the most egregious moment was when Jeb made the comment that his brother "kept us safe." Really? What about 9/11?
Have you ever heard a candidate more prone to uttering platitudes than the black brain surgeon?  Where is the there?

Dr. Ben Carson says, "But the pundits forgot about one thing, and that is the people. And they are really in charge."

Mr. Carson forgets that the people really in charge are restricted to those select voters whose state legislators see fit to let vote.
"It's also funny (actually pathetic) that the police chief can't conceive of why a student would bring something innovative to share with his teachers at school." ... it is not funny, it is Texass.

This story is incredibly upsetting to me, because I hate to think of brilliant kids who are interested in gaining knowledge and putting that knowledge to practical uses being discouraged by unimaginative adults (especially teachers!).

However, I couldn't resist pointing out that Ahmed's ALARM clock was certainly intended to "cause alarm" - just not the kind the police were referring to...

What would your response be if it had been a bomb and had blown up a filled classroom?  It didn't happen to be, but, better safe than sorry.  In this day and age when 5-year-olds get into trouble 'forming guns with their hands' (Joe Biden does it all the time but he doesn't get into trouble), aren't older children warned about bringing things to school which might look dangerous?  It's a shame that this is now the world we live in, but,.....

Irving police chief: "A person is guilty of possessing a hoax bomb if he possesses a device that is intended to cause anyone to be alarmed, or a reaction of any type from law enforcement officers."

You can see the faulty application of logic here - the police defined the clock as a hoax bomb because someone was alarmed and law enforcement was forced to react. But at no point was the device "intended" to cause alarm or a reaction - the police's job here is to assess the situation and determine that there is no bomb, and there is no intended hoax bomb.

It's like saying, well you're committing a crime because the police are here. It would be the same if someone else called the police because they thought someone's stuffed teddy bear could be a bomb - would the police charge that kid with possessing a hoax bomb, too? - because someone is alarmed and the police had to react?

It's also funny (actually pathetic) that the police chief can't conceive of why a student would bring something innovative to share with his teachers at school. "You can't bring something like that to school." Well, hopefully kids can and will continue to bring their creative inspirations to school.

Yes, yes, yes. We live in what I've long called Jerry Springer Nation. That's the reality TV show that first showed that a vast swath of the American public adores ad hominem attacks, public humiliation, ignorance and banality-the same ethic of attendees of shows at the Roman Coliseum.

These benighted American citizens gave us Nixon, Reagan, and Bush I and II while voting against their own economic interests.

Expect more of the same.

EricR says: How bad could it be? Those were my exact words when GWBush was "elected". I said he'll be good for a laugh now and then - what could happen when the country was in such a good place?
You never know what's around the corner. Take it seriously.

Is it that bad? Actually I've seen polls were the vast majority want gun background checks.
Don't more than 40 pct believe in evolution?
I guess 75 pct not believing in the Jesus return is some kind of progress. The bright side.

What can we expect in a country where only 40% of Americans believe in evolution, where gun toting and gun purchasing have become an American obsession, and one quarter of Americans are convinced that the rapture, where Jesus will again appear, will happen within their lifetimes.

Donald Trump is a logical extension of The Apprentice, The Voice, American Idol and endless repetitions of America is great through our adoration of all things ... well, American. We love our entertainers, hence we got a half baked actor in the White House with Ronald Reagan, and the Governator in the state of California.

We love the man or woman who says the most bombastic things, because 'that is what we all really want to hear, honesty'. But as another Republican debater pointed out tonight, do we really need an adolescent prankster/bully in the White House, especially when dealing with Putin?

God knows anything can happen in this country, or in an election.

And there was a teacher from Engineering appraised his invention. Why did the school not allow this kid to explain? Why did the school not talk to the teacher from Engineering? Furthermore, why did the police not call his parents (as the first thing)? Why did the police question him without his parents presence? And under what circumstance was that he was handcuffed and detained?

So, now, Const, please tell me again if the school and police handled this incident appropriately.

@Robin:

It only resembles a bomb to someone who has never seen one.

A bomb is composed of:

- metallic cladding, shaped and welded to contain the initial oxidation burst, allowing it to build explosive power;

- numerous C or D cell batteries, an electric power (heat) source;

- many pounds of an unstable or rapidly oxidizing bulk reagent like ammonium nitrate;

and,

- some kind of detonator chemical like mercury fulminate or potassium chlorate in "det-cord", or a so-called "blasting cap", connected to the bulk oxidizing reagent somit immediately ignites it.

A swift glance at that clock's open box reveals none of those are present, although the box's light weight alone reveals their absence.

How heavy would an actual bomb be? 20-25 pounds if not more.

So those dumb cops had to know Ahmed's clock wasn't a bomb the moment they picked it up. It was too light, and its weight was well balanced. They just wanted to show their contempt and disdain for Ahmed because he's a Muslim, and that the US Constitution or Bill of Rights didn't actually protect him if they wanted to get him.

You don't know the engineering teacher thought it looked like a bomb. He may have just heard the other teachers express Muslim-phobic attitudes and realized they would jump halfway to the ceiling if they saw the student do so much as pull out a cell phone and start pushing buttons: "He's activating an IED!"

Anyway, whatever gets emphasized in the movies, even non-engineers should know that explosive devices actually require explosives. An LED counter, no matter how ominously it might be beeping or counting down, doesn't pose a real explosive threat. Neither do circuit boards.

@Steve Singer: "How heavy would an actual bomb be? 20-25 pounds if not more."

Where did you learn that "fact"?

No one really believed it was a bomb. If they had, the school would have been evacuated and the bomb squad would have been called in to defuse it.

It was instead just an excuse for a bunch of authority figures to beat up on a young minority male for being smarter than them.

I am sure that is why President Obama is so sympathetic.
That's because you are technologically illiterate. I could find 15 projects in my own middle school classroom that look just as dangerous to you as that clock.

Iit just seems to be idiots everywhere and it starting to piss me off. the teachers in Irving Texas proved that education does not mean you're going to be smarter it's just a perfumed pig.
what really bothers me is that their pride even after they realize it was a mistake they announced that it was justified! when is stupidity ever justified? that tells me that pride is more important than the reputation. this is telling me that perhaps an IQ test should be given no matter what their said education is. History has proven that idiots are dangerous to humanity.

Absolutely! Also, if the teacher heard it beep, he or she clearly hasn't been told about the clock. If I heard beeping from a briefcase if grab my class and run for the hills! This has nothing  to do with his religion. The kid was foolish not to show the teacher what he had.  Then again, he's just a kid.

http://i.dailymail.co.uk/i/pix/2015/09/16/18/2C63041000000578-3236603-Ir...

I'd be worried if I see a metal briefcase with all the circuit board and a clock in there too.

Anyone who isn't smart enough to see that had this brilliant young man intended to cause a problem he would NOT have shown it to a science teacher. But then we have way to many science illiterates in our population.
Poor kid.  I can see my own 14 yr old in his face.  Travesty.  What kind of school is he at where adults don't know him?
And he followed up with putting a former British Prime Minister on the $10 dollar bill.
And the audience cheered...

Lying is easy. No "density" was taken into account.

"Unfathomable baldfaced lying"

fixed it.

The most revealing moment for me came when Jeb! Bush announced that his brother, President George W. Bush, had "kept us safe." As if 9/11 never happened. As if 9/11 didn't cost us thousands of American lives on American soil AFTER that very same w. Bush's administration had been warned that Osama bin Laden was planning to attack our USA. Unfathomable density.

The Japanese live frugally and comfortably. They produce what they consume plus a bit extra. This is admirable. Why should they produce more? For Krugman et al, the economy is always producing less than their target; hence, it is always time for more debt and stimulus. When time is bad, he calls for big deficits. When time is good, he calls for less deficit, but it is always deficit.

Even when he calls for austerity during good time, it means gov raising taxes, rather than shrinking gov to create more room for private sectors.
And I was foolish enough to think that Trump's remark about blood coming out of Megyn Kelly's "whatever" would do him in. That was a mere speed bump.

Everyone has been waiting for the wheels to come off the Trump "candidacy," and it certainly seems to have started tonight.  Fiorina roused the audience against Trump on his insult to her face.  Trump's reply, she has a beautiful face and is a beautiful woman, which is apparently his version of an apology, drew gasps from the right wing audience.  One has to think Trump's polls will decline this week.  It is too bad because the humor and the shtick have been entertaining in a weird way.  Without Trump it will just be Jesus this and Jesus that again.

I could only stomach watching short segments. The only two I could agree with on any substantive issues were Paul and Kasich.

The first "debate" drew 24 million? There had to be a lot fewer tonight. A few more like this and they'll have to buy airtime.

Rubios polished but you can't just give up a pact with the power devil
V dangerous stuff

Since Rubio doesn't show up to do his job in the Senate as a first time Junior Senator should I am thankful he can't run again in FloriDUH. OMG if he wins another public office. He is so worried about the Mexicans coming here to the USA what about all the Cubans that are granted immediate citizenship and given free US $$$ because they are from a communist country. No one else has that opportunity not from communist China, Vietnam etc... time to stop that too.

This was a cringe-worthy event. Rand Paul struck me as the most measured participant. Too bad he got so little air time. Marco Rubio showed flashes of promise. He just needs to vacate his Faustian pact with the extreme elements of the party and get real.  He seems to be have potential. As for the rest of the contenders, I envision a new Fox Television series: America's Next Biggest Buffoon.

What about their policies?  Endless war, cutting off funding for poor women who use Planned Parenthood, no diplomacy and more protection for the 1%.  Not to mention that several of them NEVER held office.  NO experience.  That needs to count!

From my perspective, Carly Fiorina was a party winner tonight. She was very specific about her actions plans, seemed well-informed and spoke forcefully about why Obama had (allegedly) failed our country. Donald came across as he often does – impolite, boorish and bullying. But his behavior improved toward the end of the debate. Ben Carson was one of the most likable, sincere and level-headed of the candidates. Bush was hurt by tonight’s debate; his approach and his arguments were awkward, lackluster and unconvincing. Chris Christie, a natural born huckster, was articulate and forceful, even while inventing his own facts. Ted Cruz relied on histrionics and incendiary rhetoric (“Planned Parenthood (was) funding the selling of body parts…..”). Rand Paul performed so-so. Kasich was generally well-spoken. Walker came out swinging (wildly) at Trump, and Trump responded by squashing Walker like an ant, making him look inexperienced and sophomoric. And later, Trump himself came across as ignorant and ill-informed when he stated that vaccinations produced autism. Rubio’s campaign messages were fear-based.

Tonight’s debate offered lively and (at time) humorous entertainment. But, I would never vote for any of these candidates

Meh. I used the full quantity of tomatoes and followed the sauce recipe but only half the zucchini (that's all I had) and used a smaller pan. Perhaps because of the quality of the tomatoes I used, the "sauce" was nothing more than a pale pink pan of chopped, flavored tomato chunks. It wasn't nearly enough for the recipe; nor was 3/4 cup cheese enough for even a halved recipe. Although it was tasty enough, it looked nothing like the picture and I don't know that I'd bother making it again.
The Donald can jump those sharks like low hurdles. So far reports of his demise have been greatly exaggerated.

Actually the only one who spoke the truth tonight was Trump, thereby sealing his doom. I'm speaking, of course, about his comment on GWB's
disastrous presidency, violating Reagan's admonition about bad mouthing
fellow Republicans, jumping the shark at last.
They'll pay for it with your Social Security and Medicare!
Tax-cuts.
Since they plan to give bibi a big chunk of our money for military use, perhaps Israel could fight those wars for us.
Most of the Republican presidential candidates will conduct  a Bush/Cheney foreign policy of  endless war. How are they going to pay for it?

@Rick. Who was once a Democrat ( Reagan)- the most over-rated (by Republicans) in history. Like Clinton's term anyone looks good when capitalism is in one of its cyclical booms. Obama has done marvels from the abyss of
08 and the unpatriotic opposition of the corporate stooges, the guys on stage.
Cracks me up.  The GOP is favoring a Democrat as their nominee.  And he's performing in the Ronald Regan Libray, no less!
LOL!!! Yeah, Trump a big winner? Low expectations, I think!
Maybe it's a generational thing...but I can't for the life of me work out if you meant your last sentence as a complement or a dig to HRC!
Did you watch the same debate I did? Trump looked embarrassed and said embarrassing things, e.g., he would find advisors later (implicitly admitting he knew nothing about foreign policy).

Another big night for Donald.  He won big time by not losing.  He came out strong. Showed more compassion than first debate. Ms. Fiorana failed big time when it came to the "likeable enough" test. Tonight's debate was a boy's night out. Joking. High fives.  Fun with one another.  Ms. Fiorana while intelligent, eloquent, quick on her feet, and even Presidential, makes Hillary Clinton look like Donna Reed.

.
I wanna vote for the one who would choose the British PM who left office with deservedly low favourability ratings.

John,

The correct answer (and none of them had it,) it to leave Hamilton on the ten and put Harriet Tubman on the twenty.

.
It seems to me that a Reveal is warranted.

Unless Wrigley Field is less hallowed than Fenway Park.

Martin, I watched the debate tonight instead of doing the puzzle. (BTW, the Cubs magic number is 10).

I don't know about a puzzle with AAA (my motor club) instead of AYS but I
loved the debate. It was a real bar room brawl.

Oh, it's Thursday and anything goes (like when they were asked what woman they wanted on a ten dollar bill).
ditto!
The lies they spew (all of them) about Planned Parenthood go unchallenged and that is the fault of our media.
Thanks Janet for the push:) Although I didn't watch the debates. Honestly, I forgot they were on last night. I donate to Planned Parenthood this morning.
I decided to use this time productively once I heard them discussing how they will destroy a major provider of health care to women. I went online and made a donation to Planned Parenthood.
All the others should have refused to answer any question regarding Trump. They should have declared such questions a waste of time for them and the viewers.

And using Trump as a foil was a losing strategy.  None of the others can out-Trump Trump, because he does not play by their rules.  And when candidates try to bounce themselves around him, they just make his shadow loom larger over them.  If any of them was a worthy national leader, they would rise to the occasion of standing out, positively, against a megalomaniac TV personality.

No Chaser... That's what I thought, too. Do middle-clas Americans want to empower a failed CEO like Carly, whose actions led to thousands of folks being without a job? She wouldn't even take responsibility, blaming the board of directors tonight, when by all sccounts it was her bad decisions that led to HP taking a huge tumble. And Trump... a wall with Mexico and a 35% tariff on cars coming into the country, and then after the auto companies shut their plants in Mexico and bring the jobs bsck to the US, allow the states to low-ball bid on those jobs by whoever would provide the lowest labor costs? Why would working-class Americans even consider a CEO or real estate mogul, knowing that CEOs make their money by cutting jobs and ripping into wage packages?

Yes, if Trump or Carly ever make it to the White House, the 90% of Americans who are not entrepreneurs and have to work for others are going to have a very rough time indeed.

Holy smokes, if Republican voters think that either Trump or Fiorina is a model CEO (as they both seem to believe they are), the regular workers in this country are going to be in for a very rough time indeed.
"Those that hate Trump" is semantically equal to "those who are sane."

CNN and Dems wanted the others to dump on Trump, and they played right into media's hands.  The panel, for the most part, looked petty and clueless as to what those of us who want to know their views on issues were hoping for.  In my book, Cruz and Carson were the winners.  Carson didn't help himself much, but, he also didn't hurt himself.  Trump--well, he's Trump, and he didn't hurt himself, either.

Agreed regards to Trump.  When you have Rand Paul codify your constitutional arguments and TWO doctors  semi-agree with  a vaccine gotcha question you have won.  Trump up by 10. Carson collapses on the " Talk to Afghani's after 9-11" theory.  Fiorina up by 10.

Some early salvos at Trump and it was beginning to look like he would have a long night, but he took it in stride and when it settled down he did OK. In fact, most of them did OK. Even Rand Paul had to agree with him TWICE (must have hurt).
Fiorina should pick up some points. Cruz and Rubio about the same or maybe add a point or two. Trump will add a few to his lead. The others will lose a little probably (how much lower can some go?). I thought Carson would do better but while again showing intelligence he was just flat. Of course many will have different opinions and those that hate Trump will continue to hate.
